column4: Anyone can help me with this problem please:  http://imagebin.org/90569
Nobody here can help you any more than what it says "Backup all data and replace the disk"
that means "It's breaking down"
yah but I dont get it ... it was fine before I installed ubuntu on it
done the same thing on my server computer..
what did you have on it before?
windows 7 , well i still have it , im dual booting..
windows 7 doesn't notify you of smart issues
feel lucky you installed ubuntu so it could tell you about the problem before you suffered data loss
ok so what I copy data and format?
copy data, use manufacturers tool to verify that what ubuntu says is correct, then throw the drive in the bin and buy a new one.
huh ur kidding its a new one..
use manufacturers tool to verify that it's broken then return it
where can I find that tool?
http://www.seagate.com/www/en-us/support/downloads/seatools
only applies to seagate drives, but you have a seagate (I checked your model number)
i can only donwload the windows one and its doing a big error when im trying to open it
what about the DOS one?
is 65 sectos alot for the disk has many bad sectors?
I dont wanna pay 70$ for a new HD for nothing u know
I don't know, maybe someone else does
could go to #hardware paste your screenshot and ask how bad it is
